folder.p: You can create a steady-state (sstate) object by loading a steady-state (sstate) file. The sstate object can be then saved as a stand-alone m-file function and repeatedly solved for different parameterisations.

ul.li: sstate – Create new model object based on sstate file.
compile – Compile an m-file function based on a steady-state file.
standalonemfile – Run a compiled stand-alone sstate m-file function.

folder.h3: Getting on-line help on sstate functions
